intro: Ferula algiersia, commonly known as Algerian ferula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Algeria. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in the summer months. Its roots are fibrous and contain a resinous sap that has been used in traditional medicine. Ferula algiersia is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions.
